interface.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Media.StreamHandler

signal.name: AddRemoteCandidate

arg.name: transports
arg.tp:docstring: Array of transports for this candidate with fields, as defined in NewNativeCandidate

signal.tp:docstring: Signal emitted when the connection manager wishes to inform the client of a new remote candidate.

signal.name: Close
signal.tp:docstring: Signal emitted when the connection manager wishes the stream to be closed.

method.name: CodecChoice
method.tp:docstring: Inform the connection manager of the current codec choice.

method.name: Error

arg.name: errno
arg.tp:docstring: ID of error, from the MediaStreamError enumeration

method.tp:docstring: Inform the connection manager that an error occured in this stream. The connection manager should emit the StreamError signal for the stream on the relevant channel, and remove the stream from the session.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: The end of the stream was reached.

method.name: NativeCandidatesPrepared
method.tp:docstring: Informs the connection manager that all possible native candisates have been discovered for the moment.

method.name: NewActiveCandidatePair
method.tp:docstring: Informs the connection manager that a valid candidate pair has been discovered and streaming is in progress.

method.name: NewNativeCandidate

arg.name: transports
arg.tp:docstring:
Array of transports for this candidate, with fields:
component number
IP address (as a string)
port
base network protocol (one of the values of MediaStreamBaseProto)
proto subtype (e.g. RTP)
proto profile (e.g. AVP)
our preference value of this transport (double in range 0.0-1.0 inclusive); 1 signals the most preferred transport
transport type, one of the values of MediaStreamTransportType
username if authentication is required
password if authentication is required

method.tp:docstring: Inform this MediaStreamHandler that a new native transport candidate has been ascertained.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: An external address derived by a method such as STUN

method.name: Ready
method.tp:docstring: Inform the connection manager that a client is ready to handle this StreamHandler. Also provide it with info about all supported codecs.

method.name: SetLocalCodecs

arg.name: codecs
arg.tp:docstring: Codecs in the same format as for SupportedCodecs, which have the same semantics as the local codecs passed to Ready

method.tp:docstring: Used to provide codecs after Ready(), so the media client can go ready for an incoming call and exchange candidates/codecs before knowing what local codecs are available.

signal.name: RemoveRemoteCandidate

arg.name: candidate_id
arg.tp:docstring: String identifier for remote candidate to drop

signal.tp:docstring: Signal emitted when the connection manager wishes to inform the client that the remote end has removed a previously usable candidate.

signal.name: SetActiveCandidatePair
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted by the connection manager to inform the client that a valid candidate pair has been discovered by the remote end and streaming is in progress.

signal.name: SetRemoteCandidateList

arg.name: remote_candidates
arg.tp:docstring: A list of candidate id and a list of transports as defined in NewNativeCandidate

signal.tp:docstring: Signal emitted when the connection manager wishes to inform the client of all the available remote candidates at once.

signal.name: SetRemoteCodecs
signal.tp:docstring: Signal emitted when the connection manager wishes to inform the client of the codecs supported by the remote end.

signal.name: SetStreamPlaying
signal.tp:docstring: Signal emitted when the connection manager wishes to set the stream playing or stopped.

signal.name: SetStreamSending
signal.tp:docstring: Signal emitted when the connection manager wishes to set whether or not the stream sends to the remote end.

signal.name: StartTelephonyEvent

arg.name: event
arg.tp:docstring: A telephony event code as defined by RFC 4733.

signal.tp:docstring: Request that a telephony event (as defined by RFC 4733) is transmitted over this stream until StopTelephonyEvent is called.

signal.name: StopTelephonyEvent
signal.tp:docstring: Request that any ongoing telephony events (as defined by RFC 4733) being transmitted over this stream are stopped.

method.name: StreamState
method.tp:docstring: Informs the connection manager of the stream's current state, as as specified in Channel.Type.StreamedMedia::ListStreams.

method.name: SupportedCodecs

arg.name: codecs
arg.tp:docstring:
List of codec info structures, each containing:
ID of codec
Codec name
Media type
Clock rate of codec
Number of supported channels
String key-value pairs for supported optional parameters

method.tp:docstring: Inform the connection manager of the supported codecs for this session. This is called after the connection manager has emitted SetRemoteCodecs to notify what codecs are supported by the peer, and will thus be an intersection of all locally supported codecs (passed to Ready) and those supported by the peer.

interface.tp:docstring: Handles signalling the information pertaining to a specific media stream. A client should provide information to this handler as and when it is available.
